# Atlantic Fintech Daily Briefing
### February 28, 2026

---

## 🌍 Top 5 Global Fintech News

- **[Fintech founder charged with fraud; AI app found to be humans in the Philippines](https://techcrunch.com/2025/04/10/fintech-founder-charged-with-fraud-after-ai-shopping-app-found-to-be-powered-by-humans-in-the-philippines/)** — *Hacker News / TechCrunch* — A fintech founder faces fraud charges after their supposedly AI-powered shopping app was revealed to be operated by human workers in the Philippines.

- **[Americans see their savings vanish in Synapse fintech crisis](https://www.cnbc.com/2024/11/22/synapse-bankruptcy-thousands-of-americans-see-their-savings-vanish.html)** — *Hacker News / CNBC* — The collapse of Banking-as-a-Service middleware firm Synapse left thousands of Americans unable to access their savings, highlighting systemic risks in embedded finance infrastructure.

- **[Jack Dorsey's Block cuts thousands of jobs as it embraces AI](https://www.bbc.com/news/articles/cq570d12y9do?at_medium=RSS&at_campaign=rss)** — *BBC Business* — Block, the payments and fintech company co-founded by Jack Dorsey, is cutting thousands of jobs as it restructures around artificial intelligence capabilities.

- **[Apple acquires UK open banking startup Credit Kudos](https://ffnews.com/newsarticle/apple-acquires-uk-open-banking-startup-credit-kudos/)** — *Hacker News / FF News* — Apple's acquisition of UK open banking startup Credit Kudos signals major tech platform interest in leveraging open banking data for financial services.

- **[Open Banking and Payments Competition](https://www.bitsaboutmoney.com/archive/open-banking-and-payments-competition/)** — *Hacker News / Bits About Money* — A deep dive into how open banking frameworks are reshaping competition in the payments landscape and what it means for incumbents and challengers alike.

## 🍁 Top 5 Canadian Fintech News

- **[Canada's economy contracted unexpectedly in fourth quarter of 2025](https://www.cbc.ca/news/business/canada-gdp-dec-2025-9.7108015?cmp=rss)** — *CBC Business* — Canada's GDP shrank unexpectedly in Q4 2025, raising concerns about the economic environment facing fintech startups and financial institutions navigating uncertainty heading into 2026.

- **[China suspending some agricultural tariffs on Canada starting March 1](https://www.cbc.ca/news/politics/canada-suspends-tariffs-some-canada-9.7108023?cmp=rss)** — *CBC Business* — China's decision to suspend select agricultural tariffs on Canada offers modest trade relief, with broader implications for Canadian economic stability and business investment conditions.

- **[Canada calls screen scraping 'unsecure,' sets Open Banking target for 2023](https://finledger.com/2021/08/09/canada-sets-open-banking-target-for-2023/)** — *Hacker News / FinLedger* — Canada's push to move beyond screen scraping toward a formal open banking framework remains a critical reference point as the country continues to refine its consumer-driven banking legislation.

- **[Ottawa makes first RDII investments in Ontario with $15 million for CDL Defence and Wolf Advanced Technology](https://betakit.com/ottawa-makes-first-rdii-investments-in-ontario-with-15-million-for-cdl-defence-and-wolf-advanced-technology/)** — *BetaKit* — The federal government deployed its first Regional Development and Innovation Initiative investments in Ontario, signalling continued appetite for tech sector funding that Atlantic Canadian ecosystems will be watching closely.

- **[Québec government invests $36 million to sustain Mila's AI research](https://betakit.com/quebec-government-invests-36-million-to-sustain-milas-ai-research/)** — *BetaKit* — Québec's $36 million commitment to AI research institute Mila underscores how provincial governments are racing to anchor AI talent and innovation, a playbook Atlantic provinces may consider for fintech.

- **[Fintech dystopia](https://fintechdystopia.com/)** — *Hacker News* — A provocative look at the darker side of fintech's rapid growth, raising important questions about consumer protection, financial inclusion, and regulatory accountability — themes directly relevant to building a responsible fintech ecosystem in Atlantic Canada.

- **[JetScaleAI secures $5.4 million to keep cloud costs and climate impact down](https://betakit.com/jetscaleai-secures-5-4-million-to-keep-cloud-costs-and-climate-impact-down/)** — *BetaKit* — A Canadian startup raises seed funding to optimize cloud infrastructure costs and sustainability, a model of early-stage tech venture financing relevant to Atlantic Canadian founders seeking capital.

- **[YSpace, York University open the door between Canada and Korea's tech ecosystem](https://betakit.com/yspace-york-university-open-the-door-between-canada-and-koreas-tech-ecosystem/)** — *BetaKit* — A new Canada-Korea tech ecosystem bridge highlights how Canadian innovation hubs are forging international partnerships, offering a template for Atlantic Fintech to explore global connectivity for regional startups.
